abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority says sick subway passengers have accounted for 3,000 train delays monthly in 2015, up from 1,800 monthly in 2012; emergency medical worker response can last for more than half hour, causing delays across entire New York City subway system.
lead_paragraph: Ill passengers have accounted for about 3,000 train delays each month this year in New York, up from about 1,800 per month in 2012, according to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

headline.main: A Hated Phrase That Subway Riders Are Hearing More: ‘Sick Passenger’
headline.print_headline: Two Dreaded Words for New Yorkers on the Go: ‘Sick Passenger’

snippet: Ill passengers have accounted for about 3,000 train delays each month this year in New York, up from about 1,800 per month in 2012, according to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.
